credit_line: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
title: Decoration of a panel
provenance: Ex collection: Piancastelli and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee.
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash
description: Vertical rectangle. Below, in the center, is a circular altar; beside it are two figures upon bases. They are connected with the altar by a festoon and with each other by a hemicycle. Upon th latter stand two gaine candelabra with winged busts on top which support the oblong frame of a landscape. Beside it are stems rising from scrolls of the candelabra, dividing above into scrolls. On top are two half figures raising a wreath above an eagle. Two putti stand upon the frame. Laterally and below is the usual background.
name: Drawing
